position: Veterans Preferred - Data Engineer (recent grad) 0-6 Months experience
description:
Military Veterans are Encouraged to Apply.  
Description
WebMD is the most recognized and trusted brand of health information and the leading provider of health information services, serving consumers, physicians, healthcare professionals, employers and health plans through our public and private online portals and WebMD the Magazine. The WebMD Health Network includes WebMD, Medscape, MedicineNet, eMedicine, RxList, theheart.org and Medscape Education. Our consumer portals and mobile health applications provide engaging, relevant and credible health and wellness information, personalized health assessment tools and access to online communities.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

WebMD's Data Management team is looking for a Data Engineer with a passion for data. You don't need to be a doctor to work the data at WebMD, but have to be able to diagnose and solve any data problems. Our data can predict and forecast the cold and flu season better than the CDC. We use
collaborative filtering on everything. If you visited us, you are probably in many look-alike models we have.

We support databases that can respond in milliseconds or aggregate billions of rows in seconds. We process 300G of data every day and support data warehouses, data lakes, data marts. We manage the data as well as the infrastructure that supports it.

This is your chance to use what you just learned in the real world. You probably coded in Java or Python, we use them. You probably stayed up all night trying to get neural network models to produce significant results, we use them. You probably had to write a Spark project that had to use all three RDD, DataFrames and DataSets. We use them.

Requirements:

This is NOT an intern role. The ideal candidate has graduated either in the fall of 2020, or will graduate no later than the fall of 2021 and will have around six months of experience post graduation or during internships while in college. We are interested in developing someone with a computer science degree or engineering degree that wants to pursue data engineering & development.

More information about this job:

Overview:

We are a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.

 

FM Global has several rewarding and exciting full-time, 6-month, paid co-op opportunities to offer to students that are motivated to apply their classroom experience, professional demeanor, and personal ambition. You will get firsthand experience while earning college credits and getting paid!

 

FM Globals co-op opportunities are based at our corporate headquarters in Johnston, RI, which is part of the greater Providence area. With a large college-age population, Providence offers a vibrant arts and entertainment scene that includes local theatre and music, collegiate and minor league sporting events, great restaurants. Also, we are not that far from the beautiful RI beaches!


Responsibilities:

SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT: As a software development co-op, you will have the opportunity to work on real-world problems and solutions with a team of hardworking developers. Your projects may consist of developing or modifying business applications, integrating business applications and databases, augmenting rapid software delivery and deployment processes, and automating software testing processes.

Qualifications:

Skills we are seeking for the software development role:

  • Enrolled in Computer Science or related degree program
  • Theory and principles of software engineering
  • Fluency in high-level programming languages (including OOP), environments, and tools for computing
  • Knowledge of databases and computer operating systems and basic knowledge of networks
  • Ability to work effectively in teams and solve problems

FM Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing and retaining a diverse workforce.

company: Regional Medical Center of San Jose
description:
Description

SHIFT: PRN
SCHEDULE: PRN/Per Diem


Regional Medical Center of San Jose is a 264 bed acute care hospital with a Level II Trauma Center. The hospital provides a host of technologically advanced services including Cardiovascular, Neuro, Orthopedic, Bariatric and General Surgery, Interventional Pulmonology and services for Women. Regional holds Joint Commission advanced certification as a Comprehensive Stroke Center and a Get with the Guidelines- Stroke Gold Plus Performance Achievement Award from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. County-designated STEMI (heart attack) Receiving Center designated Lung Cancer Screening Center, a member of Extracorporeal Life Support Organization (ECMO) and certified by The Joint Commission in Sepsis care. 

 

Our Clinical Lab Scientist teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. We have a passion for creating positive patient interactions. If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! 

 

SCHEDULE: 0.001 (PRN-Per Diem), SHIFT: As Needed

 

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Pathologists and Laboratory Managers, the Clinical Lab Scientist I performs, as assigned, all technical, analytical, clerical, and quality assurance tasks and duties associated with laboratory testing.

Qualifications

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: California Dept. of Health Services CLS License


EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Good judgment, common sense.  Ability to assume initiative for prompt

and accurate performance of tests with appropriate documentation and notification of abnormal results.  Ability to work under routine and stressful conditions in an accurate and timely manner.           

Preferred: 6 months or more experience as Clinical Laboratory Scientist or Clinical Laboratory Scientist intern in a hospital setting.   ASCP-certified Medical Technologist.

 

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: 4-year College degree in Biological Sciences (BA or BS)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Minimum:   Ability to read, write, and converse in English.  Strong organizational skills.  Advanced math and chemistry/biology knowledge. Practical and current knowledge in all

appropriate laboratory disciplines. Basic Phlebotomy skills. Basic computer skills.

Preferred:   Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. Your benefits include 401k, PTO medical, dental, flex spending, life, disability, tuition reimbursement, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and student loan repayment. We would love to talk to you about this fantastic opportunity.

Hospital Corporation of America (HCA) is a community of 94,000 Registered Nurses and 38,000 active physicians. We have over 1,900 facilities ranging from hospitals, freestanding ER’s, ambulatory surgery centers, and urgent care clinics. Our facility-based staff continues to raise the bar in patient care. Ten HCA hospitals have been named in IBM Watson Health’s top 100 best-performing hospitals based on patient satisfaction and operational data.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Atrium:

Atrium is a full-service talent management firm, focused on providing contingent workforce solutions. Atrium expertise includes Temporary and Direct Hire Staffing, Payrolling Services, Independent Contractor Compliance, Managed Service Provider (MSP) Programs and Intern Program Management.

Position Overview:

Atrium partners with a global pharmaceutical client located in the Boston Seaport District to provide managed solutions that support contingent, full time and early talent hiring. We’re looking for a passionate and motivated Early Talent Program Manager to Strategically lead early talent hiring with a heightened focus on creating meaningful university partnerships and diversity hiring.

Responsibilities:

  • The Early Talent Program Manager will create and execute a recruiting strategy that supports evolving business needs, which results in a top-tier, qualified talent pool of early talent  
  • Partner with universities and varied organizations that can produce a diverse, high quality candidate slate and talent pipeline
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will design and deploy communications to educate about the value of early talent hiring in a cadence that keeps internal stakeholders informed, engaged and accountable
  • Seek out opportunities to stay engaged and abreast of STEM recruitment best practices, internally and externally
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will partner with HR Business Partners to gain a thorough understanding of business and functional needs and provide ongoing support
  • Act as a champion for early career talent by appropriately and continuously communicating successes and wins throughout the organization to enhance credibility and reputation
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will work with flagship program managers in the business to develop recruitment strategies to identify top candidates at target schools and partner organizations
  • Develop strong, cross-functional Atrium and client relationships; maintain communication with leadership, sponsors (TA/HR), managers and candidates
  • Conduct thorough intake calls with managers to ascertain specific soft skills and additional preferences to ensure appropriate resumes are screened and presented
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will operate within client ATS and match qualified applicants against requisitions
  • Model the highest levels of integrity and deliver concierge service to support client and applicants

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, Science or related field of study
  • 3-5 years of Talent Acquisition experience within the Early Career recruitment space
  • Proven experience in assessing talent and discerning exceptional talent from strong talent; ability to maintain high bar for top caliber talent 
  • Demonstrated track record working on and closing multiple open recruiting assignments
  • Track record for assessing and building recruiting strategies around talent diversity from a racial or ethnic minority
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with the internal Client and Atrium program team
  • Advanced computer skills including proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.) and HRIS systems
  • Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, organizational, social and motivational skills
  • Ability to excel working in a fast-paced environment
  • Proven ability cultivating successful relationships internally and externally

As a PhD Applied Research Intern you will work closely with leading experts and apply real-world solutions that span across the areas of Machine Learning, Robotics, and Software Engineering. 
About the Work
Depending on your skill sets and areas of interest, your work will focus on some or all of the following below
Autonomy
Machine Learning Research and develop solutions for behavior prediction, intent understanding, planning using advanced sequence, graph neural networks based on supervised or reinforcement learning
Machine Learning Infrastructure Design scalable and optimizable systems that can process petabytes of data for model compilation & training in production
Perception Resolve real-world robotics problems in one or more of the following areas computer vision, sensor fusion, state estimation, object detection, classification, and tracking
Behavior Develop novel prediction & planning algorithms in domains like machine learning, trajectory optimization, reasoning under uncertainty, modeling system dynamics and reachability, and probabilistic reasoning.
Mapping & Localization Research, develop and implement algorithms to solve large-scale mapping and real-time localization problems for our fleet of self-driving delivery robots

Demonstrated research publications in any of the major conferences(RSS, ICRA, CoRL, CVPR, ICLR, ICML, NeurIPS, etc.)

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG Long Island Energy Efficiency Area is seeking a Planning and Evaluation Technical intern at our Melville location. This position will offer an opportunity for the intern to expand their knowledge of overall energy efficiency, electric vehicle and non-wire alternative efforts. The intern will be afforded a unique opportunity to work within PSEG Long Island's new and developing Datalake environment and provide opportunities for the intern to develop and demonstrate data science and analysis in support of the aforementioned areas. Assist the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Department in the areas of Electric Vehicle Charging Data analysis, Datalake querying and analysis, Non Wire alternative Request for Proposals development, and support in the launching a Pay for Performance Pilot program. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. This position requires candidates to be able to commute to the assigned work location in Melville, NY PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills :

3.0 GPA

position: Veterans Preferred - Local College Co-op - Emergency Services x26 Security
description:
Military Veterans are Encouraged to Apply.  
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections
  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.
  • Enforcement of security procedures
  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities
  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.


Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.
  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required.
  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.
  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.
  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.
  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.
  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.
  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.
  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.
  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.


Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.
  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr) .
  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times - both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program. Attach a screen capture from your school's website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application. Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.
  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri...max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).
  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area). Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged.
  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week ; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required.
  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school's policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment.
  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.


Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States. No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company's ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow's portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. For more information, please visit www.dow.com or follow @DowNewsroom on Twitter.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Dow is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at http://www.dow.com/en-us/contact-us or you may call us at 1-800-523-3945.

We are a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions.   • Ability to work effectively in teams and solve problems

Nearest Secondary Market: New York CIty

Location: West Conshohocken, PA
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)


    Contact:

    bcatania@judge.com?subject=Market%20Research%20Manager


    This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at www.judge.com

Job Segment: Architecture, Intern, Utility, Engineer, Engineering, Entry Level, Energy, Operations

JOB TITLE: Intern, Quality Assurance

LOCATION: San Diego, CA

The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties at any time.

SUMMARY:

This is a Quality Assurance internship opportunity for a current full-time student seeking a technical Bachelor's degree. You will gain hands-on experience with assignments that familiarize yourself with the Quality Assurance function in the defense electronics industry. The Quality Engineering internship is offered to students in order to educate them on Quality Engineering related activities and provide the opportunity to see all or part of the total manufacturing quality cycle of buying and receiving material, manufacturing and inspecting WIP, internal Quality Systems and Processes, and customer delivery. In support of and under the direction of the Quality Manager, the intern will participate in activities associated with typical Quality roles and responsibilities. The San Diego facility products are designed and manufactured to protect our ships, aircraft, and most importantly, our country. Join the Cobham San Diego team and gain valuable knowledge and experience while helping protect the U.S.A and our allied forces around the world.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and DUTIES may include:

Review/evaluate company metrics against company's Quality Policy
Participate in Corrective Action and Preventative Action (CAPA) investigations. Carry out actions as determined to be necessary. Perform effectiveness checks in support of the CAPA program and continuous improvement.
Participate in the formation and maintenance of standard work instructions, tools, and training materials.
Participate in designated continuous improvement projects.
Provide Quality Systems support.
Additional tasks and projects, as needed.

MINIMUM JOB QUALIFICATIONS: (The following qualifications can be acquired and demonstrated through experience, education and/or vocational training.)

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a minimum of two years of college level course work at an accredited four-year university with a major in Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics.
Minimum GPA of 3.0.
Strong Proficiency in Excel functions.
Role requires extensive use of spreadsheet applications.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Able to work effectively as a part of an integrated team.

SECURITY
Must meet the definition of a US person for ITAR requirements.

Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you!

If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas.

Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring.

Employment Transparency:

Cobham is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Cobham to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information. Cobham will refrain from discharging, or otherwise discriminating against, employees or applicants who inquire about, discuss, or disclose their compensation or the compensation of other employees or applicants.

Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking 2 summer interns to work in the Electric Asset Strategy team in the following areas:

• Transformer Engineering Group: • Engineering and implementation support to assist the Reliability Centered Maintenance group with transformer analytics and design aspects for IBM Asset Health Performance Platform • Perform work with transformer data, systems, contractors, and the RCM group to achieve more efficient methods of equipment ranking compared to existing methods • Model testing with various data inputs to modify and enhance model accuracy • Summer project includes inputting additional in service system equipment data into CMMS/SAP to enhance equipment database • Identify TRV capacitors and arrestors in our system based off of the one-line drawings of various substations and properly enter them into CMMS • Transmission Engineering: • Provide support of engineering for hydraulic and mechanical design aspects of underground transmission system • Development of specifications and standards for installation of "pipe-type" and extruded cable systems (i.e. pressurization plants, valve cabinets, thermal dynamic and fluid expulsion calculations, piping design) • Validation and testing of the Company's Pipe-Type Cable leak detection thermal models • Examine field data collected from monitoring systems, examining accuracy of the model and its various inputs • Modify existing model to enhance data collection and model accuracy

Job Summary

IT's vision is to power the digital future of PSEG. We are partners with the business and we are driving business outcomes through innovative use of technology. Our Technology Operations Professional is similar to our Nuclear Operations Professional role except our Technology Operations Professional role is not solely focused on Nuclear's applications and field services support but to all Information Technology systems and applications in various locations in New Jersey and Long Island. This Technology Professional will not require a degreee in Computer Science or STEM field. Thus creating the opportunity to consider candidates with IT experience without a bachelor's degree. These roles are critical as we are insourcing to lead technology solutions and drive business outcomes. This position will lead to other advanced level Information Technology roles such as Associate Business Systems Analyst, Associate Technology Product Consultants through challenging assignments and allowing them to further develop their skills in various areas within Information Technology.

Job Responsibilities

•Responsible for working collaboratively with all stakeholders and serving as a technology leader for the effective use of technologies to maintain world-class operations and delivery of solutions. Develop and deliver technology and information strategy and trends, and best practices/governance •Responsible to keep the environment current and identify continuous improvement areas as well as come up with new initiatives. Identify future technologies and implement new technologies once business approved •Define and build technical and data architectures within PSEG integrated data platform(s). Develop governance that promote data standards. Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, source-to-target maps, and database policies and guidelines •Collaborate with the application developers and database administrators to ensure database performance, integrity and security •Provide other contributions as directed by your Technology Group Product Manager and/or Product Owner

Job Specific Qualifications

Required
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or without a bachelor's degree, internship to 4 years of related IT experience

Desired
•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (STEM discipline preferred). •Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management •Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Management or Customer Relationship Management software •Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc. •Prior experience supporting a Windows environment •Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks •Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls •Experience troubleshooting network communications issues with vendors and carriers

The University of Illinois Hospital & Health Sciences System’s Hospital Pharmacy Services is seeking a full time, motivated professional for the position of Pharmacy Technician I Intern/Trainee.   Under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, the Pharmacy Technician I Intern/Trainee will perform technical job functions and responsibilities which optimize safe and efficient medication preparation and delivery.  UI Hospital Pharmacy is a fast paced and dynamic environment which relies on the teamwork of its staff to provide the highest levels of patient care and service. This position is a primarily evening shift position with possible rotation to days and midnight shift in a 24/7 hospital environment.

Duties of this position include: preparation of medication orders for unit dose and intravenous admixtures in the cleanroom, preparation of intravenous admixtures and other sterile products using aseptic techniques, compound and reconstitute drug products, demonstrate safe and effective handling of hazardous medication in preparation techniques and disposal, distribution of medications. Additional duties include: replenishing and maintaining the automated dispensing cabinet systems (Omnicell), transportation of medications to satellite pharmacies, nursing units, and patient care areas, assisting in the organization, and monitoring of pharmaceuticals and supplies, assisting with inventory control, processing orders, maintaining a clean work environment, and fully participating in quality improvement initiatives.

Successful candidates will possess a “can do” positive attitude and willingness to be trained in hospital pharmacy tasks. The selected candidate will also have excellent problem solving skills, understand the importance of reliability and punctuality within a team environment, multi-task well in a fast paced setting while paying attention to details, appreciate working in a culturally diverse environment, and possess above average computer and technology literacy skills.  

Requirements include:

  • Current licensure by the State of Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation as a Pharmacy Technician is required.
  • Mastery of pharmacy related math skills is required.
  • Must be a resident in the State of Illinois.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PTCB Pharmacy Certification or graduation from a Pharmacy Certification Program is preferred.  
  • Previous training in cleanroom compounding is preferred.

Salary & Benefits:

The University of Illinois offers competitive benefit packages, including: paid vacation days, paid holidays, State University Retirement System, excellent medical, dental, and vision packages. All Pharmacy Technicians are represented by SEIU Technical, Local 73 and governed by the contract between SEIU and the Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois, State Civil Service Statue, UIC Policies & Rules, Hospital Policies & Rules, and Departmental Policies & Rules. The intern/trainee rate of pay is $17.25 per hour.

The University of Illinois at Chicago is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer.  Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. The University of Illinois System requires candidates selected for hire to disclose any documented finding of sexual misconduct or sexual harassment and to authorize inquiries to current and former employers regarding findings of sexual misconduct or sexual harassment. For more information, visit Policy on Consideration of Sexual Misconduct in Prior Employment.

Technology Professional:
The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions.

Job Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
• Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand.
• Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications.
• Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques.
• Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware.
• Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect.
• Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements.
• Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area.
• Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment.
• Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results.
• Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience.
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
• Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as:
- Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift
- Operating Systems: Windows, Linux
- Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB
- Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio)
- Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
- Alexa skill development
• MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively.
• Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Ability to learn new business and technical concepts.

Desired Skills :

Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Relevant certification is preferred such as Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Job Summary

As a Technology Professional this role is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills and launch an exciting career in information technology. They will learn and assist in various technology projects and programs such as assisting in the development of processes and procedures related to business continuity and disaster recovery of IT systems. Participating in various projects assisting teams in ensuring systems and infrastructure plan for and incorporate required resiliency to meet business needs for high availability. In this entry level role, the successful candidate will be exposed to various IT technologies and will develop skills related to system design, integration, support and operations.

Job Responsibilities

•As a Sr Technology Professional, this role is a natural growth progression for Technology Professionals who have gained 2 or more years of relevant technology experience. They will provide technical and/or business analysis in support of technology applications or infrastructure. Analyzes simple to moderately complex inquiries and determines appropriate technical area or vendor to resolve problems and makes suggestions for improvements. Responsible for executing smaller projects and/or support tasks and typically maintain a high level of direct client interaction. Works closely with management, clients, other systems technical staff and vendors in problem solving. Consults with the supervisor and IT professionals when the appropriate course of action is unclear or a major problem is suspected. They may be responsible for operating and maintaining production systems, as well as providing hardware/software equipment support. Provides technical support and guidance to client and systems areas through consulting, teaching and publication of documentation with a focus on business continuity and disaster recovery. Participates with client and development areas in the design and implementation of new or modified systems and infrastructure. Assists clients and other IT employees ensuring business continuity is considered and planned for as new are built or existing systems are modified or enhanced. Works with client and IT teams to coordinate, monitor, track and report on disaster recovery testing. Initiates and coordinates corrective actions. Performs related duties as assigned or requested.

• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Experience working with or related coursework in .NET, HTML, SQL, Java, Java scripting or Object Oriented Design.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Desired:

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management
• Experience designing and maintaining high availability systems or infrastructure including building and maintaining disaster recovery environments.
• Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc.
• Prior experience supporting a Windows environment
• Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks
Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls

Overview:

St. Joseph Health Regional Hospital, now part of CommonSpirit Health formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health, is the highest-level major trauma center in the Brazos Valley. With the largest team of Speech Therapists in the region, we provide speech therapy to patients in our acute care hospitals, rural hospitals, and outpatient therapy clinics.

We currently have an immediate need for a Full Time Speech-Language Pathologist [SLP] to join our team in Bryan / College Station, TX.

Do you have a professional dream job? Join our team and make it a reality! With the large scope of service our SLP team is responsible for and our flexible approach to patient care, we can make your clinical setting, schedule, and/or specialization dreams come true! Do you have an area of specialization you want to develop? Join our team and let us support you in developing your specialized skills through formal mentoring and continuing education support!

As a member of our SLP team, you could serve patients in one of our multidisciplinary outpatient clinics or in our acute care hospitals. Want to work in more than one setting? You can do that too! No matter the setting, training and support is available from our team of well-rounded and experienced SLPs who work together to improve the lives of those with communication and swallowing disorders.

If you are a compassionate CCC-SLP who would like more information about this unique opportunity, connect with St. Joseph Health Regional Hospital today to experience what it is like to collaborate with talented rehabilitation professionals!

#missioncritical


Responsibilities


JOB SUMMARY

  • The Speech-Language Pathologist (SLP) is responsible for maintaining standards of professional and ethical practice following the guidelines of the State of Texas Board of Examiners for Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology. The SLP delivers quality therapy services to patients of all age groups by performing evaluations and developing individual treatment plans and goals to maximize functional outcomes. The SLP actively participates in discharge planning, implements the treatment program, and reassesses treatment results. Services are delivered within the framework of an interdisciplinary team approach, including significant others, and the patient. These services are delivered in compliance with St. Joseph Regional Rehabilitation Center's mission, ethical standards, and policies and procedures.



ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • ESSENTIAL
  • Establishes and demonstrates appropriate therapeutic procedures based upon goals set for patient and treatment disorder. Regulates rehabilitation guidelines for diet consistencies and swallow precautions.
  • Utilizes objective tests and measures appropriately for varying diagnoses. Establishes appropriate treatment plans and goals with specified time frames.
  • Maintains timely and accurate medical records. Records legibly in patient charts. Completes reports in an organized, thorough and timely manner. Completes all tasks requested by the Lead Speech-Language Pathologist in a timely manner.
  • Fosters communication with other therapists, physicians, nurses, volunteers, patients and families and other hospital personnel to establish department support. Attends and provides quality input to team conferences, departmental meetings and other hospital meetings.
  • Attends departmental and hospital in-services. Attends one seminar/conference annually.
  • Provides department specific orientation to new employees as instructed by the Lead Speech-Language Pathologist. Provides dysphagia education to new nursing employees through nursing orientation. Assists in teaching/training new/current rehabilitation techs/nursing assistants.
  • Completes all patient and family education. Provides information on outside resources to meet the patient's specific needs.

    • OTHER
    • Performs other duties as assigned to meet the organization`s needs.


    Qualifications


    QUALIFICATIONS

    • Education
      • Required: Master`s degree (e.g. MA, MS, MBA, MSN, MSW)
    • Major
      • Required: Communication Sciences and Disorders or Equivalent
    • Experience
      • Preferred: 2 years clinical experience
      • Required: CCC-SLP
    • Skills
      • Required: Basic computer and data entry skills
      • Preferred:
    • Licensure/Certifications
      • Required: Licensed by the State of Texas- Speech-Language Pathology/ Intern; eligibility to begin clinical fellowship period with ASHA membership upon completion (required); CPR certified
      • Preferred: Certificate of Clinical Competence; Member of the American Speech-Language Hearing Association (ASHA)

  • Utilizes lean principles and six sigma methodology to solve problems, and develops these problem solving skills in work teams.
  • Must be able to facilitate implementation of corrective actions to correct past performance, proactively identify safety and quality-related trends, and be responsible for initiating actions to prevent issues from reoccurring.
  • Recognizes and investigates opportunities for financial savings.
  • Understands lean principles and applies these concepts to all aspects of the production environment.
  • Use Microsoft Windows tools to manipulate and analyze large amounts of data and provide guidance on results and trends.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills are very important.
  • In this role you will assure compliance with safety and environmental practices, cGMPs Human resource Policies, Union contract and SOPs in the work area.
  • Participate in external and internal audits and inspections.
  • Initiate the investigation when a quality, safety or human resource event occurs.
  • Work with members from Quality, Human Resource, Health Services, Technical Operations, Payroll and external organizations to properly handle unplanned events.
  • Ensure that corrective actions are implemented.

Required Skills:
  • Bachelor's degree in science or engineering.
  • Candidate will need to an Aptitude for troubleshooting, technically strong, hands on person who must have Mechanical capability and demonstrated leadership
  • In the past this person could have: been and an Asoc Pocess Engineer, Mechanical Engineer.
  • Fresh Graduate/.Intern who has worked in this type of position prior to applying for this position.
  • Someone with shop floor manufacturing experience.
  • Writing skills for orders and SOPs.
  • Manufacturing entry level job.
  • Team player.


Preferred Skills:
  • 1 year experience in a heavily regulated industry (ex. FDA, Military, Nuclear, Petro-Chemical).
  • 2 years post-grad experience.
  • 2 years' working experience in cGMP pharmaceutical environment.
  • SAP experience.
  • Experience working within a Union environment.
  • Experience with technical writing related to investigations into manufacturing process variation.


Additional Details:
  • This high impact role in the Client's Manufacturing assures that products manufactured comply with cGMPs, operating procedures, and other applicable regulations and that our associated labor pay practices align with our Union contract and Human resource policies.
  • This role also has a clear advancement path through Operations Management.
  • The incumbent will assist with the direct processing of materials and data, the associated hourly workforce and computer systems to ensure attainment of business results.
  • The incumbent will effectively collaborate with a work team with motivating others, ensuring performance, schedule execution, task coordination, equipment and area preparation and effective administration of personnel policies and procedures.
  • Ability to manage conflict; affect resolution to technical and personnel challenges is key; openness to change; and the ability to affect positive change.


This 12+ month position starts ASAP.

jacqueline@alphaconsulting.com

Job Responsibilities

Habitat for Humanity Wake County is currently seeking a talented professional for the Directory of Advocacy position.
Reporting to the President/CEO, the Director of Advocacy is responsible for leading the affiliate’s advocacy efforts by promoting policies and systems that eliminate barriers to affordable housing. The Director of Advocacy will lead the department in conducting public education and awareness activities to highlight the importance of housing affordability in our community and build political will for change.

Policy advocacy and governmental affairs:

Provide leadership in setting and implementing Habitat Wake’s advocacy agenda, policy priorities, and strategy.
Lead Habitat Wake’s policy advocacy efforts, which are primarily focused at the local/regional level with some engagement at state and national levels in collaboration with Habitat North Carolina and Habitat for Humanity International.
Champion Habitat Wake’s participation in HFHI’s Cost of Home national advocacy campaign.
Guide Habitat Wake’s involvement in Habitat NC’s and Habitat for Humanity International (HFHI)’s state, national and global housing policy efforts.
Build and maintain strong relationships with local, state, and national policymakers to position Habitat Wake as a trusted advisor on housing issues.
Support the development review processes for Habitat Wake projects and mobilize the network to contact elected officials in support when needed.

Public awareness and education:

Speak on behalf of Habitat Wake to promote its advocacy agenda in collaboration with the CEO.
Raise awareness for equitable housing policies and call out systems that perpetuate the need for Habitat, especially through a racial justice lens.
Partner with the Communications department to set advocacy communications strategy, including key messaging, media, public relations, and online engagement.
Position Habitat Wake as a thought leader and resource on affordable housing, especially regarding homeownership
Educate policymakers and community leaders on housing policy and issues affecting Habitat Wake’s ability to further its mission.

Community partnerships:

Forge partnerships with organizations across the housing continuum so that all may work together to advance access to housing affordability.
Provide leadership for Wake Affordable Housing Coalition (WAHC) in its efforts to promote local housing solutions through a shared agenda.

Grassroots mobilizing:

Lead efforts to engage Habitat Wake’s constituency with housing advocacy messages and present opportunities for stakeholders to take action.
Facilitate Habitat Wake’s involvement in network-wide advocacy events, including Habitat NC Legislative Day, Habitat NC Week of Action, Habitat on the Hill, World Habitat Day, etc.
Recruit board members, advocacy committee and homebuyers to participate in HFHI’s national lobby day, Habitat on the Hill.
Work with the Homeownership Services team to empower homebuyers and neighborhood residents to become housing advocates.
Partner with the Faith Relations department to engage faith coalitions in advocacy from a faith-based justice perspective

Research and analysis:

Oversee research activities to provide analysis that supports the public awareness and policy objectives of the organization.

Strategic planning and departmental leadership:

Set the strategy for Habitat Wake’s advocacy initiatives in collaboration with the Advocacy Committee and CEO.
Represent the advocacy function on Habitat Wake’s senior leadership team.
Supervise the Advocacy Coordinator role and other staff/intern/volunteer positions within the department.
Manage department budget and track expenditures.
Report advocacy metrics and progress on a monthly basis.
Develop monthly reports for the Advocacy Committee and Board of Directors.
Engage in strategic planning to set annual objectives within the context of Habitat Wake’s organizational goals.

Advocacy Committee:

Lead the Advocacy Committee in shaping Habitat Wake’s advocacy agenda and setting annual policy priorities that guide the affiliates advocacy work.
Recruit for the Advocacy Committee and onboard new members.
Work with the Advocacy Committee chair to set meeting agendas.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

5+ years of experience in advocacy, government relations, public affairs and/or awareness campaigns aimed at influencing policy change.
Knowledge of affordable housing issues and policy at the local, state and/or national level
Experience developing and managing efforts to influence policymakers and external stakeholders.
Ability to think strategically and use judgement in decision-making.
Prioritize work to meet objectives when balancing multiple projects with differing deadlines, importance, and stakeholders.
Strong relational, analytical, writing, and verbal skills for communicating with diverse populations.
Ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with Habitat Wake staff, Advocacy Committee, community partners, and policymakers.
Ability to organize work and time while working efficiently and effectively in an office with frequent interruptions.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team and with great energy and persistence.
Excellent public relations skills with a passion for the organization’s mission.
Critical thinking, problem solving, accuracy and attention to detail.
Experience effectively managing a team.
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite, Office 365, and virtual meeting platforms, Asana project management software.
Familiarity with data sets such as U.S. Census, Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (CHAS), HUD Income Limits, HUD Fair Market Rents (FMR) preferred.
Willingness to pursue ongoing training (e.g. affordable housing & advocacy) and professional development.
Bachelor’s degree in political science, public affairs, public policy, communications, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

position: Staff Engineer, Process Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Engineer uses process engineering and food science principles to lead process development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be leadership of chocolate process development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff engineer is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners. The successful candidate will report to the group’s Principal Engineer. 


 


Summary of major duties:



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 

  • Lead chocolate process technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY chocolate process development.

  • Lead complex process development and process validation to support product commercialization in various areas for the Hershey Company.

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.

  • Determine next steps through problem solving. 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies.

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 

  • Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the

  • performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 

  • processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results.

  • Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.   



Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:  
•    Experience leading a cross-functional team in a development of new process and/or technologies. 
•    Sound technical knowledge and capability of applying knowledge to research projects. 
•    Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
•    Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
•    Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
•    Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
•    Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
•    Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
•    Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 
Education: BS degree in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry, or related field required.
Experience: 5-10+ years (B.S. food/engineering degree) or 3-5+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment  in process development, process validation, food engineering.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered. 
Experience in chocolate processing is a plus.

position: Local College Co-op - Emergency Services & Security
description:
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

   

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections

  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.

  • Enforcement of security procedures

  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities

  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.

  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required. 

  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.

  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.

  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.

  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.

  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.

  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.

  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.

  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times – both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your school’s website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri…max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school’s policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

 

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company’s ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow’s portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020.
