Job Summary

IT's vision is to power the digital future of PSEG. We are partners with the business and we are driving business outcomes through innovative use of technology. Our Technology Operations Professional is similar to our Nuclear Operations Professional role except our Technology Operations Professional role is not solely focused on Nuclear's applications and field services support but to all Information Technology systems and applications in various locations in New Jersey and Long Island. This Technology Professional will not require a degreee in Computer Science or STEM field. Thus creating the opportunity to consider candidates with IT experience without a bachelor's degree. These roles are critical as we are insourcing to lead technology solutions and drive business outcomes. This position will lead to other advanced level Information Technology roles such as Associate Business Systems Analyst, Associate Technology Product Consultants through challenging assignments and allowing them to further develop their skills in various areas within Information Technology.

Job Responsibilities

•Responsible for working collaboratively with all stakeholders and serving as a technology leader for the effective use of technologies to maintain world-class operations and delivery of solutions. Develop and deliver technology and information strategy and trends, and best practices/governance •Responsible to keep the environment current and identify continuous improvement areas as well as come up with new initiatives. Identify future technologies and implement new technologies once business approved •Define and build technical and data architectures within PSEG integrated data platform(s). Develop governance that promote data standards. Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, source-to-target maps, and database policies and guidelines •Collaborate with the application developers and database administrators to ensure database performance, integrity and security •Provide other contributions as directed by your Technology Group Product Manager and/or Product Owner

Job Specific Qualifications

Required
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or without a bachelor's degree, internship to 4 years of related IT experience

Desired
•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (STEM discipline preferred). •Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management •Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Management or Customer Relationship Management software •Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc. •Prior experience supporting a Windows environment •Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks •Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls •Experience troubleshooting network communications issues with vendors and carriers

Nearest Secondary Market: New York City
Job Segment: Operations Manager, Intern, Product Manager, Computer Science, Operations, Entry Level, Technology

position: Senior Research Engineer, Process Technology Development
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA   


 


Summary:


 


Reporting to the Sr. Manager in the Process Technology Development R&D, the Sr. Research Engineer will be responsible for the process development research related to the Better-For-You initiative and Sugar reduction from benchtop to pilot plant to commercialization. 


 


In addition to working with R&D team members, considerable interaction is expected with Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality, and other Supply Chain departments. The Senior Research Scientist will manage relationships internally and externally with business partners, suppliers, research institutes, universities, and other service providers to deliver required research results. The Senior Research Engineer assumes a leadership role in complex projects and guides them through Hershey Innovation process with a cross-functional team. He or she will participate in project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.


 


This individual will take the initiative to secure, from all available sources, pertinent advice, ideas, and information having a bearing upon the project. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required. Experience in leading a cross-functional technology and/or product development project to commercialization is desired. Presentation of the project results will be expected in both written and oral forms.


 


Responsibilities:


 


Project Leadership for Technology Development - Lead (60%) Assist (5%) Supervise (5%)



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities

  • Lead chocolate process technology development workstreams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which will focus on BFY chocolate process development

  • Champion assigned projects through Hershey Innovation process by owning process specifications that deliver quality product at commercialization

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations

  • Bring technical rigor to troubleshoot technical issues

  • Determine next steps through problem solving

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the performance of tests or experiments. Lead the development of new processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results. Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.  


 


Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation 



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data, and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.


 


Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:


 



  • Sound technical knowledge capable of applying knowledge to research project

  • Excellent communication, written and critical thinking skills

  • Lead process development, operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment

  • Strong project management and organizational skills

  • Demonstrated success in leading multiple and simultaneous projects.

  • Possess strong computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)

  • Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities

  • Strong mathematical skills

  • Experience in leading a cross-functional research and/or product development project.


 


Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 


 



  • B.S. degree in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry, or related field required

  • 7+ years (with B.S. food/engineering degree) or 5+ years (with M.S.) in R&D environment in process development, process validation, and/or food engineering

  • Intern and prior research project work will be considered

  • Confectionary experience in chocolate and sweets processing preferred


 


 


The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Requisition ID:  62703 

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

Our Technology Professional role is an entry level role that provides the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills in windows and DBA. This Position is a direct report to Senior Technology Infrastructure Supervisor within IT System Services. Network Operations are 24x7 shift rotation work and overtime work may be required. Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience.

Job Responsibilities

•Learn network/LAN design and implementation for data and converged communications infrastructure based largely on Cisco equipment networking technologies. Participate in Network improvement projects and provide support services to assist internal client organizations in the pursuit of their business objectives. Participate in requirements gathering, solutions design, systems configuration and development for a variety of Networking, cloud and wireless solutions. •Acquire wireless and mobile technology skills in a highly collaborative organization. Participate in network, security and wireless projects and improve productivity of internal client organizations and customers by deploying new hardware technology solutions focused on a combination of on premises and cloud based implementations. •Work as a team member on projects related to network security and firewall improvement implementations. Participate in requirements gathering, solution design, testing and moving new systems into production. •Learn to execute Infrastructure projects through the PSEG's Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the hardware design, test and implementation process.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required:
• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or a related STEM discipline.
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access)
• Self-starter with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Other:
• PSEG will not offer visa sponsorship in connection with this position.
• Candidate must have a valid driver's license and be willing to travel within the state of NJ and to PSEG Long Island locations.
• Network Operations are 24x7 shift rotation work and overtime work may be required.

Education

Bachelor in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

Bachelors in Information Technology or Information/Computer Security

For a Technology Professional must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and internship to 2 years of technology experience. For a Sr Technology Professional, must have 2 years or more years of technology experience

• Learn to execute projects through the PSEG's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the application design, test and implementation process using Agile and 2 Pizza concepts.

• Work with Product teams in Two Pizza Team approach similar to Amazon product development and CICD model.

• Develop and implement process improvements, Next Best Actions, Automation opportunities, and Pro-active communications for customer care applications.

• Become a subject matter expert (aka Product Consultant) for technical and solution architecture that will include configuration, development, integration, and customization of digital channel products.

o Technology Professional - must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and internship

• Programming Experience working with or related coursework .NET, HTML, SQL, C, C++, Java, JavaScript, NODE.JS, JQuery, REST API's, JSON, Angular or Object Oriented Design,
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of Agile development and project management

• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

• Knowledge of Agile development and project management

PSEG Nuclear Application Support department is looking to fill several openings located in Hancocks Bridge, NJ. Also will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems.

This position provides opportunity to be involved several product developments and will:
•Learn to execute projects through the PSEG's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the application design, test and implementation process using Agile and 2 Pizza concepts. •Work with Product teams in Two Pizza Team approach similar to Amazon product development and CICD model. •Develop and implement process improvements, Next Best Actions, Automation opportunities, and Pro-active communications for customer care applications. •Become a subject matter expert (aka Product Consultant) for technical and solution architectures. •Configure, Design, Develop using Visualforce, Apex, API, SOQL, Workflows, MuleSoft, and other development tools provided by PSEG •Analyze end-user needs and designs, develop and test software to satisfy demand. Perform build versus buy analysis for business demands. •Partner with Business Analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provide recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications. •Create process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develop technical workflows using different modeling techniques. •Collaborate with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware. •Ensure that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect. •Analyze application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements. •Code applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area. •Provide daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Apply operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey. PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy.

Job Summary

This is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills the areas of Customer Care, and Call Center technologies such as Salesforce, MuleSoft and emerging technologies. This position is a direct report to IT Group Product Managers of Smart Services.

Job Responsibilities

  • This position provides opportunity to be involved several product developments:

    • Develop and support Digital Customer Channels. Participate in requirements gathering, solutions design, systems configuration and development for a variety of products such as Alexa, Google Home, Mobile App and MyAccount.

    • Learn to execute projects through the PSEG's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the application design, test and implementation process using Agile and 2 Pizza concepts.

    • Work with Product teams in Two Pizza Team approach similar to Amazon product development and CICD model.

    • Develop and implement process improvements, Next Best Actions, Automation opportunities, and Pro-active communications for customer care applications.

    • Become a subject matter expert (aka Product Consultant) for technical and solution architecture that will include configuration, development, integration, and customization of digital channel products.

    Other:
    • PSEG will not offer visa sponsorship in connection with these positions. Positions will be located in Newark, New Jersey in the PSEG General Office.
    • Candidate must have a valid driver's license and be willing to travel within the state and to PSEG LI locations.
    Learn network/LAN design and implementation for data and converged communications infrastructure based largely on Cisco equipment networking technologies. Participate in Network improvement projects and provide support services to assist internal client organizations in the pursuit of their business objectives. Participate in requirements gathering, solutions design, systems configuration and development for a variety of Networking, cloud and wireless solutions.
  • Acquire wireless and mobile technology skills in a highly collaborative organization. Participate in network, security and wireless projects and improve productivity of internal client organizations and customers by deploying new hardware technology solutions focused on a combination of on premises and cloud based implementations.
  • Work as a team member on projects related to network security and firewall improvement implementations. Participate in requirements gathering, solution design, testing and moving new systems into production.
  • Learn to execute Infrastructure projects through the PSEG's Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the hardware design, test and implementation process.


Job Specific Qualifications

Required:
  • • Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or a related technical discipline.
    • Minimum 3.0 GPA
    • Level of experience required ranges from internship within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
    • This is a multi-level position and placement is dependent upon skills, knowledge and experience of the selected candidate.
    o Technology Professional -internship minimum
    o Sr Technology Professional - at least 2 years of experience within technology
    • Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
    • Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access)
    • Programming Experience working with or related coursework .NET, HTML, SQL, C, C++, Java, JavaScript, NODE.JS, JQuery, REST API's, JSON, Angular or Object Oriented Design,
    • Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
    • Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
    • Good written and oral communication skills.
    • Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.
    • Candidate must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity. Successful candidate must demonstrate and value differences in others' strengths, perspectives, approaches, and personal choices.


Desired:

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of Agile development and project management
• Certifications in technical specialties such as AWS, Mobile application development is desired
• Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
• Alexa skill development

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

PSEG is looking for talented technology professionals to join our team. Our vision is to power the digital future of PSEG. We are partners with the business and we are driving business outcomes through innovative use of technology. This is a multi-level position and placement is dependent upon the skills, knowledge and experience of the candidate. There are multiple positions available and they are located at our General Office in Newark, New Jersey.

Our Technology Professional role is an entry-level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills the areas of Microsoft windows, RedHat Linux and database technologies. This Position will work directly with the internal clients in support of their operations.

Job Responsibilities

•Potential environments may include but not limited to as follows:
o Microsoft Windows technologies such as Active Directory, Patching, Windows security, server services, server builds, etc.
o RedHat Linux such as Operating System configuration, Patching, server builds, etc.
o Database technologies such as oracle, SQL server and other open source databases, database installations, configuration, security models, patching, performance tuning, etc.
o Storage Area Networks such as SANs, fiber switches, replication procedures.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required:
• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or a related STEM discipline.
• For a Technology Professional, a minimum 3.0 GPA and a level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise. For the Sr Technology Professional at least 2 years of related work experience of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access)
• Experience working with or related coursework in .NET, HTML, SQL, Java, Java scripting or Object Oriented Design.
• Self-starter with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Required for Sr Technology Professional - DBA:

• Experience with Database Performance Tuning and Monitoring
• Experience with Database Backup and Recovery
• Experience with System Monitoring
• Understanding of Database Disaster Recovery (DR) Practices and Architectures
• Familiarity with tools - EMC Networker, OEM, OID, Tripwire
• Experience with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP network
• Familiarity with Oracle RAC and / or Microsft SQL Server Always On
• Knowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley controls
• Familiarity with automation technologies - Ansible, Python, Scripting, PowerShell etc.

Desired:

• Experience with mySQL, PostgreSQL.
• Experience with System Monitoring, i.e., Microsoft Systems Center
• Experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL.
• Experience working with databases that are clustered and attached to a SAN infrastructure.
• Experience with DB2.
• Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL certifications.
• ITILv3 Foundations certifications

The world is becoming digital. Data and AI are one of the hottest growth markets. DvSum is on a mission to bring data-driven decision making to every business. DvSum helps companies make their data trust-worthy and reduce data preparation time for analytics and AI. We do it through our one-of-its-kind data intelligence platform built for the cloud. Companies like Coca-cola use our platform to ensure high quality data drive business operations and analytics.

Video Intro:

https://rb.gy/2iuqio

We are looking for a data science intern to work with our supply chain analytics team to learn and contribute to a Customer's Industry 4.0 / Digital campaign. The predictive analytics project entails working with real-world customer data creating 2 prediction models - one for machine performance prediction and one for demand sensing.


WHAT WE OFFER :

  • Full-time internships in the heart of Silicon Valley. (Remote ok)
  • Exposure to a fast-paced, fun and inclusive culture
  • A chance to work with world-class experts, real-world data and challenging problem
  • A chance to work on an exciting, skill and resume boosting Data, ML/AI project
  • Opportunity to provide meaningful contributions to a real system used by customers
  • High level of access to supervisors (manager and mentor), detailed direction without micromanagement, feedback throughout your internship, and a final evaluation.

Requirements

WHAT WE EXPECT :

Required Qualifications:

  • Masters in quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or equivalent)
  • 2+ years of experience working as a data analyst / data scientst in manufacturing or consumer products company
  • When: Summer (June – September)
  • Proficiency with Python, core, programming and use of python libraries related to data analysis and data classification algorithms
  • Proficiency in ML/AI algorithms for supervised learning and regression problems
  • Confident, Organized and have a high attention to detail and driving results through collaboration, teamwork, and a positive attitude
  • Ability to distill informal customer requirements into problem definitions, dealing with ambiguity and competing objectives
  • Ability to manage and quantify improvement in customer experience or value for the business resulting from research outcomes
  • Ability to quickly adapt to changing priorities and generate innovative solutions in an extremely fast-paced environment
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills, ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts.

Preferred Qualifications

  • A PhD in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or equivalent)
  • Functional knowledge of building ML models in Azure using Azure Data Lake and Spark / Data Bricks
  • Experience leading cross-functional projects and effectively communicating with both business and technical teams

Benefits

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN / GAIN :

  • Experience building ML models on real-world customer datasets
  • Learn about supply chain data models and ML/AI use-cases in Industry 4.0 and Supply Chain
  • Experience deploying ML models in Azure

DvSum is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and DvSum.

How do you want to make your impact?

position: Computer Science Intern - Finance Summer Internship
description:
Company Description

Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).

Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA.  Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN.  We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees.  We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

Job Description

The Stratas Finance Team has an exciting opportunity for a talented Information Computer Science intern to help build small scale applications.   As an intern with Stratas Foods, you will not only work with and learn from industry professionals, but you will also share in the culture of teamwork at Stratas Foods.  

As an intern, key responsibilities will include the following:

  1. Conduct needs analysis
  2. Build small scale applications for the finance department based on business needs
  3. Work with the IT Department and Master Data Governance Team
Qualifications

  • An individual who has at least 1-2 years of undergraduate studies remaining
  • A concentration in Information Technology or related field
  • Application development background through any of the RAD (Rapid Application Development) softwares
  • Strong communication skills
  • A highly motivated self-starter
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Macros
  • Proficient in SQL – Nice to have
  • Proficient in PowerBI – Nice to have
  • Critical Thinker


Additional Information

Competencies:

Communications – Strong negotiation and interpersonal skills in dealing with those both internal and external to Stratas are critical to success

Leadership - Ability to lead others in the directions necessary to achieve mutually beneficial goals is important

Analytical Skills – Having both the ability and competency to evaluate a variety of alternatives and pick the best solution in a dynamic work environment

Root cause problem-solving techniques:  Critical to a line manufacturing process

Developing teamwork and productivity:  Being proactive in employee relations efforts serves all well

Tired of web companies masquerading as tech startups? Looking for real development, with real impact

We are a pioneering autonomous building systems startup company. We are building a groundbreaking autonomous control platform for high-performance buildings and the future of smart cities. 

We have a position for a computer science intern that offers the opportunity to be a meaningful part of a team, develop production code, build test infrastructure, construct IT solutions, and solve real-world engineering problems.

This is an internship position (or entry-level), with the potential of a full-time position for the right candidate. Opportunity for involvement is limited only by your enthusiasm.

What you will be doing:

  • Developing a client-side application software
  • Building test infrastructure 
  • Database development for cloud and test support
  • Building machine learning back-end
  • Developing data visualization interfaces
  • IT infrastructure management 

You must have:

  • Strong research and problem solving skills
  • Experience with MacOS
  • Networking and system administration knowledge and experience
  • Strong programming skills (e.g. Javascript, Swift, Typescript, etc)
  • Must be able to both work in a team and have the ability to self manage on your own

  • Experience with MVC design patterns

It's helpful to have:

  • Fundamentals of human-computer interaction design

Compensation:

  • Competitive compensation; Hourly wage, based on experience 
  • Medical, dental, vision (full time
  • Free drinks, snacks, and catered lunches
  • We can support academic credits for students
  • Must be diligent and get work done, but we do respect powder days

To apply for this position:

You must have or near completing a B.S. or better. Unless you have significant experience, a coding bootcamp isn't sufficient computer science background for this position. With your introduction and resume, include a description of a project (of any type) you personally created, devised, built, managed, organized, or designed that was of your own self-initiative. Also include any portfolio work, links to your code repo, personal website, etc.

About PassiveLogic

PassiveLogic builds the world's first autonomous platform for buildings. We make an infinitely configurable platform that enables users to design their own custom autonomous systems. We've reinvented the fundamental principals of automation to replace todays antiquated control logic.Our focus is democratizing automation for the average person, have an unmatched impact of energy savings, while ensuring buildings and smart cities are accessible, self-optimizing and human-centric.

Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Summer Research Intern.

The summer student will be responsible for performing image segmentation for MRI datasets that will be analyzed by machine learning algorithms to predict musculoskeletal disease.

Job Responsibilities:

  • organize and clean datasets
  • learn basic musculoskeletal anatomy on images
  • perform image segmentation
  • prepare datasets as input for machine learning algorithms
  • develop or write code for machine learning algorithms

Additional Position Specific Responsibilities:
Highly motivated to learn about biomedical imaging problems and machine learning.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in engineering or computer science strongly preferred.
  • Must be enrolled full time student status

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong background in computer science or engineering.
  • Experience in machine learning or computer vision methods as applied to medical imaging is a plus.

Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

Position Overview:
Nationwide IT Services (NIS) is seeking summer 2021 interns for our program supporting one of our key corporate initiatives. As an intern, you will work in a team environment delivering a working technical solution that can be leveraged for use by various existing customers and other government agencies.

Program Summary:
Work will consist of a wide range of project tasks to include web application design and development, database scripting, code reviews, technical documentation, and research into existing and emerging technologies. Interns will learn how to analyze both a living and pre-existing (legacy) codebase to re-engineer and improve upon both user-facing and back-end features.  NIS teams build more modern, scalable solutions that use open source and cloud-based architectures to provide improved user experience, security, reliability, and cost effectiveness. Interns will review and contribute to detailed technical requirements and documentation, learn and adopt DevOps best practices, contribute to prototypes and test plans, design new features, gather user feedback, research and present options to users and developers, analyze alternatives from a complexity and business cost to value basis, and write code to demo or present to existing and potential customers. NIS will gain from the intern's research and insights into the latest coding and design practices, while providing interns with an opportunity to build new skills and apply them to a key corporate initiative.

Additional Internship Information:
This is an eight-week paid internship program. We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the eight weeks and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared towards technical college students that are actively enrolled at an accredited university.

Our internship program is designed to provide college students the opportunity to learn about Nationwide IT Services and gain meaningful, hands-on work experience in a professional environment. We place an emphasis on developing the next generation's workforce. As part of our internship curriculum, we provide the opportunity for each intern to interact with various stakeholders within the company. This includes the chance to complete technical training courses, attend brown bag sessions with our executive leadership team and participate in teambuilding activities with mentors and fellow interns.

Job Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited university
  • Must be a US citizen
  • Must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment, and establish and maintain interpersonal relationships
  • Ability and desire to quickly acquire knowledge of new subject matter areas
  • Must possess strong decision-making skills, and the ability to organize and prioritize work
  • Must possess the ability to quickly ramp up on technical details of a project
  • Must take initiative to provide creative alternatives / solutions to intractable challenges or systemic problems
Nationwide IT Services, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, disability or protected veteran status.

position: IT Technology Ops/Cloud Engineer & Service Management Intern
description:
Edwards offers its university talent an opportunity to create innovative, life saving devices and techniques that help physicians provide better opportunities for patients around the world. As a global leader in treating advanced cardiovascular disease, we know that millions of people benefit from our passion, our focus, and our innovation.


Key Responsibilities:


• Participate in day-to-day end user support and configuration of business application systems including creating new user accounts, acknowledging tickets, troubleshooting issues and following up with users.


• Participate in authoring test cases and manual testing of systems by following step by step test scripts and documenting test case failures and escalating to team members.


• Perform current-state system analysis and create current/future state system-level process flows and sequence diagrams with guidance from senior Business Systems Analysts


• Partners with business and IT resources to capture and document technical, functional and non-functional requirements


• Responsible for providing business systems analysis services (analyze, define, troubleshoot, design, test, deliver, maintain).


• Basic understanding of project management and software development, Web Architecture, and familiarity with Cloud Based technologies.


• Must have a strong work ethic, organization skills, the desire to learn and is not afraid to ask questions


• Assists in creating and analyzing metrics for strategic business process improvement.


• Knowledge of AWS Cloud Services


• Knowledge of ServiceNow/ITSM platform


• Knowledge of ITIL and reporting tools is a plus


• Proficient with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.


• Good interpersonal and communication skills


• Ability to prioritize time-sensitive assignments based on input from manager


• Performs administrative duties such as scheduling, coordinating and attending meeting with system users, taking meeting minutes, preparing dashboards and presentations.


Education and Experience:


+ Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent area of study.

+ Currently enrolled as a student for the duration of the Internship project

+ Must be in good scholastic standing (3.0+ GPA or equivalent).

+ Permanent residency is required


Additional qualifications:


+ Prefer junior or senior, but will consider other class levels.

+ An interest in exposure to Project Management, SaaS technology, Information Technology, Cloud computing.


Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.


Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 15,000 individuals worldwide.


For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life.

position: Research Intern, R&D, Computer Science & Engineering
description:
Research Intern, R&D, Computer Science & Engineering


General information


City: Palo Alto


State/Province: California


Country: United States


Department: Research & Development


Date: Thursday, May 13, 2021


Working time: Full-time


Ref#: 20011499


Job Level: Individual Contributor


Job Type: Internship


Job Field: Research & Development


Seniority Level: Associate


Description & Requirements


PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients. Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.


The Intelligent Systems Lab at PARC has need for an intern with experience in formal methods, satisfiability and Satisfiability Modulo Theory (SMT). The area has multiple ongoing projects that contain combinatorial optimization components. The internship will match the intern with the project that best matches their abilities. A successful internship will result in papers at major AI conferences and patent applications.


Qualifications:


+ Currently pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Information and Data Science, or related fields.

+ Successfully completed beginning-graduate coursework in AI.

+ Proven record of scientific investigation as demonstrated by project reports, conference presentations, publications (e.g., AAAI, IJCAI)

+ Experience in programming in Python or LISP and in software engineering.

+ Experience in empirical evaluation for complex intelligent agents.

+ Experience with combinatorial optimization, satisfiability, machine learning or algorithmics.

Description
IMPORTANT NOTES
1. REQUIRED: Concrete experience in reinforcement learning that goes beyond downloading an RL codebase and running it.
2. Data science and 'concrete' experience in RL are very different – the latter requires prowess both in mathematics and computer science, REQUIRED for this role. This difference is paramount.
?Just because someone has Client and Python on their CVs do not qualify them for RL.
3. Look for people (a) who have published in the field of RL in top conferences i.e., original contribution, or (b) have a codebase that is original in GitHub/Bitbucket.

###

We seek candidates who have the skills and research experience to join a new team to push the boundaries of pure mathematics, theoretical statistics (incl. parametric and non-parametric Bayesian statistics) and machine learning (primarily in deep reinforcement learning). A proven record of publications (at least one first-author paper in reputed conferences such as NeurIPS, COLT, UAI, ICML, AISTATS, JMLR, PAMI, and others) and prototyping skills in terms of developing algorithms, in any language, is critical.

As an industry R&D laboratory, we pursue theoretical and applied research to feed into the other. Like academia, knowledge dissemination is through the publication of papers in reputed journals, conferences and workshops, and patents. We have current collaborations with world-renowned academic institutions; encouraging such industry-academia partnerships is important for research scientists.
Qualifications, skills and other information:

1. Internship applicants will generally study towards a PhD degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, and allied disciplines. (core requirement)
2. Knowledge of reinforcement learning (essential) and multi-agent systems (desirable)
3. Knowledge of Bayesian statistics (desirable)
4. Hands-on experience with at least one of the following: Python, C/C++, Java, etc. (core requirement)

The Position:

We are looking for current Computer Science or Computer Engineering students to join one of our software development teams in Tampa, Florida for an internship. If you are a current student or a student taking a gap year due to COVID and are interested in designing and building unique security software that no one else is building, then this exciting opportunity is for you. As part of a larger team, you will be given project-oriented work helping develop professional cybersecurity solutions used to protect critical infrastructure around the world. You will get exposure to every stage of the software development lifecycle, planning, design, coding, testing, and deployment amongst other stages.

What You Will Be Doing:

• Project oriented hands on coding assignments and professional development activities
• Using latest cloud and on-premise technology stacks
• Contributing to the design and architecture of the solutions you work on
• Enhancing the automation testing framework to achieve test driven development
• Starting your career as a software engineer under the mentorship of experienced team members

What We Need From You:

• A passion for Cyber security and learning
• Progress toward a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, or a related major
• Examples of extracurricular programing projects (e.g. on Github)
• Strong collaboration and communication skills

About OPSWAT

OPSWAT is a global leader in critical infrastructure cybersecurity that helps protect the world's mission-critical organizations from malware and zero-day attacks. To minimize the risk of compromise, OPSWAT Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) solutions enable both public and private organizations to implement processes that ensure the secure transfer of files and devices to and from critical networks. In total, 98% of U.S. nuclear power facilities and more than 1,000 organizations worldwide spanning Financial Services, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Aerospace, Transportation Systems trust OPSWAT to secure their files and devices; ensure compliance with industry and government-driven policies and regulations, and to protect their reputations, finances, employees, and relationships from cyber-driven disruption. For more information, visit www.opswat.com.

To apply for this position, please send your resume and cover letter to us via JobScore. Special consideration will be given to those candidates whose cover letter indicates that they have viewed our website. Please, no drop-ins, calls, or faxes.

Job Title:


Equipment Data Science Intern (Fall 2021)


Job Description:


*This position is payrolled via payroll agency.


Group/Role Overview:

The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.


Responsibilities:

•tEnsure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics

•tWork closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems

•tHelp to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting

•tEstablishing models for detecting anomalies in the data

•tUsing other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users

•tWorking with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.

•tWork with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization

Qualifications:

•tAn ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline

•tStrong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics

•tExperience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)

•tCandidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential

•tExcellent verbal and written communication skills a must

•tAbility and desire to work in a multicultural team

•tMust be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship


State/Province:


NY


City:


Albany


Subsidiary:


TEL Technology Center, America, Inc.

*Machine Learning Intern,* *Lincolnshire, Illinois, 60069*

 


Kelly Services is seeking a Machine Learning Intern for one of our top clients in Lincolnshire, IL.


 


*Length:* 06/28/2021 to 10/29/2021


*Type:* Contract W2


*Pay Rate: *$35-39/hr.


 


We seek candidates who have the skills and research experience to join a new team to push the boundaries of pure mathematics, theoretical statistics (incl. parametric and non-parametric Bayesian statistics) and machine learning (primarily in deep reinforcement learning). A proven record of publications (at least one first-author paper in reputed conferences such as NeurIPS, COLT, UAI, ICML, AISTATS, JMLR, PAMI, and others) and prototyping skills in terms of developing algorithms, in any language, is critical.


 


As an industry R&D laboratory, we pursue theoretical and applied research to feed into the other. Like academia, knowledge dissemination is through the publication of papers in reputed journals, conferences and workshops, and patents. We have current collaborations with world-renowned academic institutions; encouraging such industry-academia partnerships is important for research scientists.


 


*Qualifications, skills and other information:*


 




	* Internship applicants will generally study towards a PhD degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, and allied disciplines. (core requirement)

	* Knowledge of reinforcement learning (essential) and multi-agent systems (desirable)

	* Knowledge of Bayesian statistics (desirable)

	* Hands-on experience with at least one of the following: Python, C/C++, Java, etc. (core requirement)

	* REQUIRED: Concrete experience in reinforcement learning that goes beyond downloading an RL codebase and running it.

	* Data science and 'concrete' experience in RL are very different – the latter requires prowess both in mathematics and computer science, REQUIRED for this role. This difference is paramount. Someone who just has ML and Python on their CVs do not qualify them for RL.

	* Good candidates may have (a) published in the field of RL in top conferences i.e., original contribution, or (b) have a codebase that is original in GitHub/Bitbucket.

About Gro:

Gro Intelligence is tackling two of the biggest problems facing the world today: food security and climate change. We understand and quantify the complex interplay between food, weather, trade, agriculture, and macroeconomic conditions in a world upended by climate change, a growing population, and more. The team at Gro has built a platform that allows businesses, non-profits, and governments to better plan for and adapt to these changes. With offices in both Nairobi and New York, Gro has the financial backing of prominent investors such as TPG Growth, Intel Capital, Data Collective, and GGV. Gro is a diverse, intellectually curious team of technologists, scientists, and business professionals united by a shared commitment to build AI that addresses agriculture, food, and our climate on the most fundamental level.

What You'll Do:

  • Build the web-based user interface of the Gro Intelligence Excel Add-in and migrate the application to a more modern front-end framework (e.g Angular, React)
  • Explore new methods and technologies to improve user experience and system performance.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver on the product vision.

Qualifications:

  • Knowledge in Object-oriented programming and CS fundamentals (algorithms, data structures)
  • Familiar with modern web development concepts
  • Experience with server-side JavaScript and one or more modern front end frameworks (e.g Angular, React)
  • Proficient in HTML & CSS, comfortable with jQuery
  • Experience in building design system and modularized UI library

What We're Looking For:

  • The ideal candidate will have built and deployed software services at scale
  • Knows what it takes to ship high quality code
  • A builder of productive and collaborative teams
  • A great team player – you have a point of view, and know how to humbly raise it
  • Care about user experience and have an eye for good design
  • Be open-minded to languages/tools/frameworks to use in order to solve a particular problem. You're excited to learn something new when the need arises.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience in building UI with complicated interactions and animations
  • Background in Computer Science or related field
  • Experience with other backend languages (e.g python, Go, C++ ,Java)
  • Familiar with SQL/NoSQL database
  • Portfolio is a plus

Gro was founded in 2014 and currently has offices in Nairobi and New York City. The company was built on diversity and the knowledge that artificial intelligence is only as good as the human intelligence behind it. Gro's team represents the world it is modeling. At the company, we speak more than 27 languages and we comprise a wide range of experts, from agronomists and crop scientists, to mathematicians, engineers, data scientists, market research analysts, designers, historians, and philosophers. Our culture fosters collaboration between people of extremely different backgrounds that allows us to accomplish things that would otherwise seem impossible.

The Position:

We are looking for current Computer Science or Computer Engineering students to join one of our software development teams in Tampa, Florida for an internship. If you are a current student or a student taking a gap year due to COVID and are interested in designing and building unique security software that no one else is building, then this exciting opportunity is for you.  As part of a larger team, you will be given project-oriented work helping develop professional cybersecurity solutions used to protect critical infrastructure around the world.  You will get exposure to every stage of the software development lifecycle, planning, design, coding, testing, and deployment amongst other stages.  

 

What You Will Be Doing:

• Project oriented hands on coding assignments and professional development activities
• Using latest cloud and on-premise technology stacks
• Contributing to the design and architecture of the solutions you work on
• Enhancing the automation testing framework to achieve test driven development
 • Starting your career as a software engineer under the mentorship of experienced team members

 

What We Need From You:

• A passion for Cyber security and learning
• Progress toward a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, or a related major
• Examples of extracurricular programing projects (e.g. on Github)
 • Strong collaboration and communication skills

 

About OPSWAT 

OPSWAT is a global leader in critical infrastructure cybersecurity that helps protect the world's mission-critical organizations from malware and zero-day attacks. To minimize the risk of compromise, OPSWAT Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) solutions enable both public and private organizations to implement processes that ensure the secure transfer of files and devices to and from critical networks. In total, 98% of U.S. nuclear power facilities and more than 1,000 organizations worldwide spanning Financial Services, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Aerospace, Transportation Systems trust OPSWAT to secure their files and devices; ensure compliance with industry and government-driven policies and regulations, and to protect their reputations, finances, employees, and relationships from cyber-driven disruption. For more information, visit www.opswat.com.

Overview:

UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

 

This position is Limited Term. The internship will last 6 months with the opportunity to extend an additional 6 months based on organization/team needs. The individual will work up to 40 hours a week during the summer months and approximately 15-20 hours a week during the school semester. These hours can be flexible to meet your school needs.

 

The IT Desktop Support Intern must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of the Organization in a positive manner.

Responsibilities:

1) Preparing and deploying IT hardware - 50%

Assist the End User Services team by receiving new hardware, tracking inventory, imaging laptops and desktop computers, installing and testing hardware. This includes scheduling and coordinating with end users, following a tested process of updating the Operating System, installing required applications, following provided instructions, testing and troubleshooting as needed. Working with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

 

2) Office Moves - 20%

Assist with moving staff from one location to another and move staff from one area of a building to another following a move plan and move schedule. This includes disconnecting and reconnecting PCs, monitors and peripherals as well as documenting cable and switchport details.

 

3) PC Replacements - 30%

Assist with the replacement of Desktop hardware. Coordinate and schedule with end users, the replacement of their desktop PC and decommission the old PC following documented procedures. Work with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

Qualifications:

 

  • Pursuing associates or bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science or related field preferred.
  • A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office applications, and Outlook preferred.
  • Experience in providing customer service or support preferred.
  • The ability to demonstrate strong interpersonal skill, communicate clearly and interact professionally with other employees preferred.
  • Minimum of 6 months experience in customer service or support required.

 

UW Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Minorities, Protected Veterans, Women, and individuals with Disabilities. We strive to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is home to a diverse workforce where employees at all levels model knowledge of, belief in and a commitment to cultural competence.

description:
Your success is a train ride away.

Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.

Are you ready to join our team?

SUMMARY OF DUTIES

The internship is an exciting opportunity to learn about train control systems including dispatching and Positive Train Control (PTC) systems which are critical to sustaining and enhancing safety of the intercity travel network.  The intern will work collaboratively with Amtrak staff across IT and Operations Engineering projects. The intern will have an opportunity to learn broadly about Amtrak's business practices while being charged with focused technical research projects with support and guidance from Amtrak senior staff. 


Amtrak provides rail transportation, as well as connecting services operated by partner carriers.  The internship will focus on improvements to multimodal travel that combines Amtrak with other forms of transportation.  This may include enhancements to technology systems in train dispatch, ET SCADA & PTC systems.  The intern may also undertake research on developing new routes that connect with Amtrak. 


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Work under the supervision of assigned IT Manager(s).
  • Create maps and diagrams of train track in dispatch Territory.
  • Design & development of reporting system.
  • Compile data from written sources as well as direct interviews. 
  • Write clearly and succinctly on technical topics. 
  • Create documentation of technical processes and best practices in layman terms. 

 

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must be actively pursuing a degree at an accredited educational institution.  
  • Must be actively pursuing an undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science.
  • Must have at least 2 years of academic undergraduate studies completed or a junior status at minimum.  
  • Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

 

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience with computer programming and/or application design. 
  • Knowledge of Database programming (MySQL and MS-Access).
  • Knowledge of Networkin Routers, Switches, Firewalls, VLANs. 
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Server, Domain and Workstation Architectures and Administration• Linux and/or Windows Programming. 
  • Configuration and/or Data Management. 
  • Knowledge of X-Windows, Motif under Linux environment.
  • Knowledge of C++, C, Java and scripting languages under Linux environment.
  • Eclipse / Bit Bucket Development environment.  
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and CAD software. 

 

COMMUNICATIONS AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS: 
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills.

Description/Job Summary

Fruit of the Loom, an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. & leading international basic apparel company, has an immediate opening for a Data Science Intern at its Corporate Headquarters in Bowling Green, KY.

The Data Science Intern supports the company's data-driven objectives by providing advanced analytics insights and recommendations by utilizing data mining techniques, including pattern detection and statistical analysis, and data visualization. This role is expected to work with Data Science and department team members to collaborate with business teams to efficiently and effectively answer business questions. The Data Science internvalidates findings and presents them in ways that can be easily understood by business counterparts. 

Responsibilities/Duties

Data Research and Conversion

  • Work with the business stakeholders to identify what the business requirements are and the expected outcome. Model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and geo-location information or social media.

Data Validation and Presentation

  • Work in iterative processes with the business and validate findings. For example, validate discovered correlations across data with the business. Discovered findings can appear counter intuitive. Expose the rationale to their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Be prepared to present back results that contradict common belief. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.

Required Experience

  • Undergraduate or graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Business Informatics, Statistics or Mathematics or related field, or equivalent years of professional experience
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
  • Programming knowledge and skills, experience with statistical programming software (i.e. R, Python), and knowledge of database query languages (i.e. SQL)
  • Ability to identify solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
  • Knowledge of statistical forecasting and machine concepts (i.e. decomposition, linear regression, exponential smoothing, support vector machine, k-means clustering, boosted decision-tree) and software (i.e. R, STATA, Weka, Python)
  • Data visualization experience using PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar technology

Required Qualifications

  • 0-2 years of experience with data and statistical analysis, with mathematical modeling skills

position: Software Intern Tech II (Calabasas, CA, US)
description:
Job Description

Job Description

We are looking for a highly energetic and technically enthusiastic Intern to help develop and test SW products and features for Keysight's Network Application and Security solutions group.

 

In this position, you get an opportunity to work with highly experienced Software developers to design, develop and test software features. You will be assigned specific project  to develop new features, learn and contribute to the overall test solutions. You will work with the project specific Agile team and other cross functional teams across the R&D organization. It requires working in self-driven, willing to learn new tools/technologies and innovative problem solving skills in a high performing environment. You will participate in design and implementation across the entire product lifecycle using Agile development methodologies.

•    Master's or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related fields (Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering or equivalent)

•    Knowledge/Experience in developing, testing software programs using C, C++, Python in Linux platforms

•    Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills 

•    Good communication skills and demonstrated ability to achieve results in team settings and individual assignments

 

 

Desired Skills:

•    Hands-on exposure to working with low level system interfacing with OS, HW, FPGA components

•    Project Experience in Device driver and Kernel driver programming using PCIe or I2C or similar interfaces in Linux

•    Knowledge in Networking programming using TCP/IP and Network protocol Stack

•    Experience in shell scripting, automation using Python or Go or similar languages

Job Function

*Internships

Job ID : 41427

Virtuoso is the leading global travel agency network specializing in luxury and experiential travel. We bring together 20,000 of the world's most sought-after travel advisors and more than 2,000 elite travel companies, from five-star hotel groups and renowned cruise lines to boutique properties and high-end adventure travel outfitters around the world. Whether in the pages of Virtuoso Life magazine, on Virtuoso.com, in e-mail newsletters, or across social media, our goal is to inspire people to travel Virtuoso-style, with the help of a Virtuoso travel advisor and Virtuoso-preferred partners.


Position Summary: Working closely with the Business Intelligence team, you will be responsible for delivering analysis and visualizations from Virtuoso's data warehouse to empower business users across the organization to make data driven decisions. In this role, you will develop technical skills required to combine data sources across Virtuoso's network and critical thinking skills to communicate insights that have previously been unavailable, identify trends and anomalies, and be able to recognize when reports, queries, and analysis need more investigation.


Essential duties and key responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  1. Develop data visualizations using BI tools (Domo) that inform business users of performance, opportunities, and room for improvement across our product offering
  2. Support, deliver, and explain reporting across the business to inform users of how reports operate, what they are displaying, and what they mean
  3. Work with complex projects and business requirements while making output user friendly to users across the organization
  4. Perform comprehensive and in-depth partner, member, and marketing analysis
  5. Develop technical skills working in SQL and Snowflake

Educational and skills requirements:

  • Currently pursuing a BA/BS degree in MIS, Finance, Computer Science, or related field with an estimated graduation date of December 2021/May 2022
  • Strong computer skills and proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Communicates effectively, both orally and in written form
  • Strong analytical and research skills with high attention to detail
  • Preferred - Strong academic track record (GPA of 3.2 or above)
  • Preferred - Relevant work experience or work experience in a professional environment (e.g., internships, summer positions, school jobs)

This is a paid internship for the 2021 Fall Semester.

Organization: 

The Bail Project is a national nonprofit designed to combat mass incarceration by disrupting the money bail system one person at a time. The Bail Project’s National Revolving Bail Fund provides free bail assistance to low-income individuals who are legally presumed innocent, and whom a judge has deemed eligible for release before trial contingent on paying bail. We enable our clients to return home to their families and communities while awaiting their court dates, connect them with community organizations that can assist them in accessing resources, and provide reminders and assistance to ensure that clients return to court for their court dates. 

The Intern Program:

The Intern Program invites members of the community, 18 or older, to intern with The Bail Project. All individuals who intern with TBP will be members of a cohort. All interns will be expected to participate in educational opportunities, community-building events, and other cohort activities. Interns will be expected to work 10-15 hours a week based on their availability. All interns will begin work on August 30, 2021. This is a hard start date and we encourage all candidates to consider this requirement carefully.

Position Summary:

TBP is seeking an individual with an interest in criminal legal system reform and improving outcomes for incarcerated and returning community members to assist with several data and research projects to improve TBP’s knowledge of system operations and community resources. This individual will also provide data input support by utilizing Salesforce.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week, flexible schedule

Term: August - November 2021

Start Date: 8/30/21

End Date: 11/30/21

Reports to: Volunteer and Intern Coordinator

Compensation: $15 an hour.

Responsibilities:

  • Document team referrals to social service providers in Salesforce.

  • Document client experiences with social service providers in Salesforce.

  • Use case lookup system to vet potential clients and provide recommendations to Bail Disruptors

  • Use court records and client records to improve TBP understanding of which clients retained private attorneys rather than public defenders and the impact that had on their cases.

  • Use court records and client records to determine which judges set bail for TBP clients.

  • Analyze and present preliminary findings on the degree to which judicial discretion plays a role in determining initial bail affordability and subsequent bail forfeitures for TBP clients.

  • Research client criminal backgrounds to understand past charges in relation to current charges.

  • Develop a list of community institutions and direct service agencies throughout TBP’s service area that may be willing to partner with TBP in providing support for TBP clients, advocate for the use of said institutions and agencies to the team, and add to the database within Salesforce.

  • Research and connect with activist organizations working on criminal justice reform that clients may be interested in joining and advocate for the value in promoting said organizations.

  • Participate in cohort events geared towards social justice, policy, nonprofit management, etc.

  • Engage in weekly or bi-weekly check-ins with supervisor to evaluate progress, identify next steps, etc.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

You are driven, highly organized, and have a deep commitment to The Bail Project’s mission to eliminate race- and wealth-based disparities in our criminal justice system. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable working independently or in a team-based setting, and with a strong commitment to our clients. 

To excel in this role, you likely bring the following:

  • Passion for understanding and changing the system of mass incarceration and criminal justice

  • Familiarity or personal experience with the local criminal justice system a plus

  • Strong communication skills

  • Interest in data or computer science

  • Basic computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel preferred)

  • Some experience with quantitative research 

  • Well-organized and professional

  • Familiarity with Salesforce a plus

How to Apply: 

Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. In the cover letter, please address the following:

  • Why do you want to intern with The Bail Project?

  • Please share 1-2 experiences that highlight why you would be a strong candidate for this internship and how you meet the qualifications for the position.

No emails, faxes, or phone calls, please. Applicants will be notified regarding whether or not they have been selected for an interview. Applications without cover letters will not be processed.

Only candidates who live within a 90-minute radius of Augusta will be considered for this role.

The Bail Project is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and actively seeks the candidacy of people of color, women, LGBTQIA people, and formerly incarcerated individuals. We are committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff.

Note: This position should ideally be filled by an undergraduate or graduate student, someone directly or indirectly impacted by the bail system, or an individual coming from an internship-providing institution.

Overview:

At Tintri, we pride ourselves on challenging convention, so we hire people that choose to see old problems in new ways. The group includes technology geeks and master marketeers, but more importantly it's a collection of people who care deeply about their work. That makes for healthy debate, new ideas and unmatched learning. Our customers adore us because we've built an environment where employees can do their best work every day.   Today, more than 80% workloads are virtualized, but the storage on which those workloads depend was built for a physical world. That forces companies to contort their storage and endure unnecessary complexity. Tintri is the ONLY intelligent infrastructure provider that has architected a solution specifically for virtualized and private cloud environments. Our customers include 6 of the Fortune 15.
